DataElement.preferredName: Biomarker Genetic Alteration Sensitivity Diagnosis Disease Progression Or Approved Treatment Intolerance Occurrence Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to questions regarding the diagnosis of sensitizing genetic alterations and whether the patient has experienced the worsening of disease over time or an intolerance to approved therapeutic procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biomarker Molecular Genetic Variation Sensitivity Diagnosis Disease Progression Or Approval Therapeutic Procedure Intolerance Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention._Irregularity in either the expression or sequence of a Gene in diseased versus normal tissue sources. (NCICB)_The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The worsening of a disease over time._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Measurable and quantifiable biological parameters (e.g., specific enzyme concentration, specific hormone concentration, specific gene phenotype distribution in a population, presence of biological substances) which serve as indices for health- and physiology-related assessments, such as disease risk, psychiatric disorders, environmental exposure and its effects, disease diagnosis, metabolic processes, substance abuse, pregnancy, cell line development, epidemiologic studies, etc

Concepts.definition: A characteristic that can be objectively measured and serves as an indicator for normal biologic processes, pathogenic processes, state of health or disease, the risk for disease development and/or prognosis, or responsiveness to a particular therapeutic intervention.

Property.preferredName: Molecular Genetic Variation Sensitivity Diagnosis Disease Progression Or Approval Therapeutic Procedure Intolerance Occurrence
Property.preferredDefinition: Irregularity in either the expression or sequence of a Gene in diseased versus normal tissue sources. (NCICB):The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:The worsening of a disease over time.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.:An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

Concepts.definition: Any alteration in the inherited nucleic acid sequence of the genotype of an organism.
The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Acceptance as satisfactory by an authoritative body; established by authority; given authoritative approval.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
An inability to absorb or metabolize certain substances in the normal way.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has a sensitizing
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a sensitizing alteration in EGFR, ALK or ROS1, have they experienced disease progression or intolerance to treatment with an approved EGFR, ALK or ROS1 inhibitor, respectively?

DataElement.changeDescription: 11/8/18 TT released/PClark.; 1/10/18 approval received and released. 1/8/18 tt/10166.
